blurb: Discover your spark at Anyone Can, where campers ages 4-12 try new activities and find their passions. A variety of arts, athletics, and STEM activities help campers learn at their own pace. Each week, campers make friends, have fun, and find a new spark that keeps them excited about life and encourages them to try new things. June 1-July 10

Let your kids step back in time or rewrite the future. Let their curiosity and imaginations run wild as they travel back to the ancient world, discover secret superheroes, investigate historic buildings, chase down news stories, write epic tales, and more. June 1-26

camp_name: Atlanta Ballet Centre For Dance Education Summer Dance Programs
blurb: Register now for an exciting summer filled with dance, movement and creativity! The official school of Atlanta Ballet offers summer programs for all ages and skill levels, led by dedicated instructors who are passionate about enhancing skills, boosting confidence and fostering a love for dance. June 8-July 25

If your child loves LEGO ® and you’re searching for an unforgettable camp experience, Builder Bunch is the perfect choice! Georgia’s #1-rated LEGO camp offers exciting weekly themes like Robotics, Stop-Motion Movie Making, 3D Sculpture, Remote-Control Vehicle Design and Architecture. Ages 6-12. June 1-July 24

Inspire innovative thinking with fun-filled STEM experiences designed to spark creativity and a love for learning. Rising K-6 campers will collaborate with friends to tackle hands-on, open-ended challenges. They’ll team up with robotic capybaras, ride the waves of entrepreneurship, uncover the power of protecting their ideas and build their own DIY space rocket! June 1-July 17

Career discovery should be engaging, inspiring, and hands-on. Career Camp ATL is designed to immerse students grades 6-12 in real-world experiences that go beyond what schools offer, providing practical insights, mentorship, and skill-building opportunities through career exploration workshops that will help shape their future. June 14-17

Puppet Camp is the ultimate summer adventure! Campers will have a blast learning about puppetry traditions from all over the world, building their own puppets, and playing and exploring with new friends. Summer Puppet Camps are designed to inspire their specific age group. June 1-July 31

Club SciKidz is the best place under the sun for STEM based science and technology camps. 70+ offerings include topics such as Veterinary Medicine, LEGO Robotics, Minecraft, American Doll, and Environmental Sciences such as Climate Change and Rescuing the Rainforest! June 8-July 24

CMC Atlanta’s popular themed day camps for kids strike the perfect balance between a creative, effective music curriculum and some good, old-fashioned fun. Themed camps for grades K-5 and Performance Workshops for grades 6-8 and 9-12 include private lessons; four convenient Atlanta locations. June 1-July 31

Dad’s Garage, the award-winning nonprofit theatre based in Atlanta, offers comedy and performance camps to kids with a focus on the theatre’s specialty: improv. Campers of all performance levels learn the basics of improv—communication, collaboration, and resiliency—in a supportive, encouraging, and fun atmosphere. June 1-July 31

Calling all kids and teens who love the spotlight! One-week theatre camps including K Pop Campers, Wicked, Harry Potter, Tangled, Marvel, Hamilton, Zootopia, Puppetry, Descendants & Zombies, Newsies, High School Musical and Percy Jackson! Full-day camps for ages 5-16, plus Counselor-In-Training and Internship programs. 13 locations. June 1-July 31

ITP camps deliver a fun, well-rounded racquet experience featuring tennis, pickleball and padel at one convenient facility. Racquet Camp (ages 8+) emphasizes skill development and match play; Day Camp (ages 5-7) combines racquet sports with creative activities, games and character building. June 1-July 31

Marist is made for unforgettable summers! The ones that plunge kids deep into new experiences that unleash curiosity, teach new skills, and amplify talents. Tackle sports. Explore the arts. Compose music for video games. Marist Summer Camps give kids a place to shine. June 1-July 31

At MJCCA Day Camps, campers make lifelong friendships, try something new and have the best summer ever! The possibilities for an amazing summer are endless with theme, sports, performing arts, teen and traditional camps for kids in rising Pre-K-9th grade. May 26-July 31

Get ready for an unforgettable summer! Young creators ages 6-18 dive into hands-on experiences that ignite imagination, inspire innovation and build a better world. Whether they’re building with LEGO®, designing future cities, or reimagining Atlanta’s neighborhoods, kids and teens explore the power of design in fun and meaningful ways. June 1-July 24

Plan your summer fun at MPCS! Academic, arts, athletic and, “faith and fun” camps. From fishing and photography, to football or engineering, your child can experience it all. Full-day, Afternoon Adventures, Dude Perfect Camp, or Pickleball are just a few of the more than 140+ summer programs offered in a Christ-centered environment. June 1-July 17

Your child is unique, and their summer should be, too. Choose a customized camp program where your child can dive deep into areas of interest, or have a blast at NCCS’s weekly high-energy Camp Eagle – within a nurturing Christian school environment. June 1-July 17

Academic enrichment blended with hands-on, theme-based experiences, keeping students engaged and curious. Full-day sessions strengthen skills in students’ target language, math and ELA, while diving into exciting weekly STEAM-inspired themes. Each week builds on the next, so learning builds on knowledge and continues without feeling like school. June 8-July 17

The Adventure Begins Here! Camps for K-12th grade for Pace students and students from other schools. Camp options include academic, athletic, STEAM, visual/ performing arts and specialty programs! Driver’s Education, SSAT, Baby Sitters Club camps and workshops are available for older students. June 1-July 17

Embark on an unforgettable adventure at Trinity School Summer Camp! Designed for children ages 4 to 13, weekly camps offer a mix of academic, specialty and sports activities. Campers can experience outdoor exploration, art, basketball, LEGO building, soccer, computer games and much, much more. June 1-26 and July 27-31

Walker Summer Programs are the best way to spend your summer! Offering an extensive and diverse selection of enrichment opportunities for students ages 3-14. Half-day and full-day options available weekly. Early drop-off and extended care are available. June 1-July 24

Wesleyan Summer Camps make summers fun for all children ages 3-14! Day camps have fun weekly themes, with structured activities and free time for outdoor activities, arts and crafts, and games. Enrichment, athletic, academic and fine arts camps are available in a wide range of options. June 2-July 18

With over 200 offerings, Woodward Academy Camps offer scholars, athletes and artists an array of enrichment, athletic, academic, and activity camps on two campuses in College Park and Johns Creek. Camps are open to the public and are accessible through an exceptional bus system. May 26-July 24

Join Zoo Atlanta for an exploration of all things wild! Summer Safari Camp is the perfect experience for children ages 5-14. From Zoo explorations and scientific investigations, young explorers will be immersed in hands-on learning while having fun and meeting friends! Each week campers embark on a different Zoo expedition, exploring wildlife and wild places. May 26 – July 31
